relation: Anything your heart desire. You want to shoot basketball or workout. There is a Rec Center. You get to watch college games for free. Certain clubs or organizations will have party.
The food in Morehead is perfect. Many varieties of restaurants to choose from. Like taco bell and some restaurants you probably never heard from like Asian Express, and Wing Span.
The dorm life is okay. It is not the best but you feel welcome.
The Academic is rigorous. Well certain academic courses are tough like Physics, Math classes, and any ology classes.(ex: Sociology, Psychology, and etc.)
If you are in a another state and you want to go to Morehead State University, Ky, I advise you to get scholarships. Lots and lots of scholarships.

Professors are fantastic. They are willing to help you on courses that you don't understand or failing. Different clubs or organizations that you can get in. Certain things can be a little better in Morehead State, but overall it is a great college.
pageTitle: Morehead State University (MSU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {155716=The cost for a meal plan is pretty costly. The earliest that restaurants are open is 7:30 and the latest is 2am during the week. On the weekends, everything is closed by 10pm. There is a variety of restaurants that are located on campus, plus you can add money to your EagleCard and use it at some restaurants off campus as well., 384990=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 226331=When I came to Morehead State University I decided to check out the Greek life. I joined Sigma Alpha Epsilon in the fall semester of 2012 and I'm very satisfied. It allowed me to meet many new people and keep me occupied with things to do in this small town., 4292=Try to look at scholarships specific to this school in September of your senior year. There are several that are specific to this time when some people are just starting to look. If you get your foot in the door during this time, you will do much better financially. Also, make sure you are ready to wake up at 2 am for fire drills. Yes, this will happen at any school you go to., 282373=ADUC which is only open from around 8- 4:30 is the best place you will eat on this campus. It has a bunch of fast food restaurants and is absolutely fantastic though it can get a little crowded. RFOC which is located in Alumni Tower is okay. This is where most go to eat dinner, it's not the best but, it's still pretty awesome compared to eating Ramen all the time.}

textAfterTable: Catherine from Louisville, KY 11/05/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 2 of 91 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Music Education, Computer Science, Pre-Vet, Ag, small town students or urban based students. Morehead is a great school with wonderful administrators, and deserves more credit than it gets. I am part of the Music Education department, and I love it. There is such a community here. Students really help each other out and the professors will create a personal bond with you. If you want a small town and a small campus, this is the place for you. Tips for prospective students Try to look at scholarships specific to this school in September of your senior year. There are several that are specific to this time when some people are just starting to look. If you get your foot in the door during this time, you will do much better financially. Also, make sure you are ready to wake up at 2 am for fire drills. Yes, this will happen at any school you go to.
